data.event: First granted in 1763, Colonial Governor Benning Wentworth named the town Peeling after an English town.

event.title: 1771, his nephew, Governor John Wentworth, gave

data.event: In 1771, his nephew, Governor John Wentworth, gave it the name Fairfield, after Fairfield, Connecticut.
The town was renamed Woodstock in 1840 for Blenheim Palace in Woodstock, England.
Several inns and hotels were built to accommodate the wealthy, who sought relief from the summer heat, humidity and pollution of coal-age Boston, Hartford, New York and Philadelphia.
